quote: the 10 high-threat illegal aliens who arrived today are being housed in vacant detention facilities
The Trump administration has moved more than 30 people described as Venezuelan gang members to the U.S. Navy base at Guantánamo Bay
Over the last week, the United States government has sent more than 80 men to Guantánamo Bay
On Thursday the New York Times said 98 men had been sent to the island base by Immigration and Customs Enforcement (Ice) between 4 and 11 February.
As of Friday, 126 migrants were detained at the naval station, according to a Defense Department official.
The Trump administration is holding more than 150 migrant detainees at Guantánamo Bay.

As of Tuesday, there were more than 120 of what the administration calls criminal aliens under guard at the detention facility at Guantanamo Bay, according to a U.S. defense official. Approximately 50 other individuals are also being held at the base's migrant facility, which was being readied to hold nonviolent individuals.
There are currently 51 aliens housed at the MOC, and 127 aliens housed at Camp VI.

The Trump administration on Thursday transferred all of the Venezuelan migrants it had brought to the U.S. military base at Guantánamo Bay, Cuba, suddenly emptying a detention operation that it had just as abruptly started  this month.
TNo new migrants had been sent to the base since the Homeland Security Department cleared it of 178 Venezuelans on Thursday.
The military transported about 15 immigration detainees from Texas to the U.S. base at Guantánamo Bay, Cuba, on Sunday
